Posted By: Laguz (9/25/2011 6:41:29 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Gaffy00: No, it is, and will prove itself to be, the best card printed from this set.  
  
In fact, I am surprised at the 4.3 rating. The only reason it should be so low is people hating on the printing of such a powerful card.  
  
Just with some cheap spells, like Spell Pierce, Path to Exile, Vampiric Tutor, even Lightning Bolt, this card is very efficient. Do not forget that it can come out as a surprise-blocker and basically trade for an opponent's creature, while adding another effect.  
  
Expect to see a lot of these in decks, and very few in trade-binders.
posts.html:
@Gaffy00: No, it is, and will prove itself to be, the best card printed from this set.

In fact, I am surprised at the 4.3 rating. The only reason it should be so low is people hating on the printing of such a powerful card.

Just with some cheap spells, like Spell Pierce, Path to Exile, Vampiric Tutor, even Lightning Bolt, this card is very efficient. Do not forget that it can come out as a surprise-blocker and basically trade for an opponent's creature, while adding another effect.

Expect to see a lot of these in decks, and very few in trade-binders.

Posted By: CJM2 (10/24/2011 2:25:55 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
He is pretty sweet, but usually if he is in your opening hand and you don't have a cheap spell, then he is just a flash bear, which is not all the great, once you get the ball rolling, he is pretty much the sickness.   
  
I recommend running forbidden alchemy with this dude, and probably black or red, green could be pretty cool, but the only spell you'd really want to flash back is beast within, and that is 5 mana, and your getting a weak acidic slime.   
  
I must admit though, he is great fun to play with, so damn oppressive, "ill cast x spell (knowing you have used all 4 mana leaks), Snapcaster for ...."
posts.html:
He is pretty sweet, but usually if he is in your opening hand and you don't have a cheap spell, then he is just a flash bear, which is not all the great, once you get the ball rolling, he is pretty much the sickness.

I recommend running forbidden alchemy with this dude, and probably black or red, green could be pretty cool, but the only spell you'd really want to flash back is beast within, and that is 5 mana, and your getting a weak acidic slime.

I must admit though, he is great fun to play with, so damn oppressive, "ill cast x spell (knowing you have used all 4 mana leaks), Snapcaster for ...."

Posted By: Mattmedia (10/24/2011 4:09:41 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Run this with basically anything, and you have an edge over your opponent. Here are a few ideas-  
  
[Timely Reinforcements](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Timely Reinforcements)  
[Join the Ranks](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Join the Ranks)  
[Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade)  
[Mana Leak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Leak)  
[Think Twice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Think Twice)  
[Bump in the Night](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bump in the Night)  
[Sorin's Thirst](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sorin's Thirst)  
[Memoricide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memoricide)  
  
This thing is going to an auto-include in any staple w/u control deck, and with damn good reason.  
  
Edit:  
  
Just so people know, [Curse of Death's Hold](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Curse of Death's Hold ) shuts this card down. It can't flashback if it can't enter the battlefield, so keep that curse safe and it will keep you safe.
posts.html:
Run this with basically anything, and you have an edge over your opponent. Here are a few ideas-

Timely Reinforcements
Join the Ranks
Doom Blade
Mana Leak
Think Twice
Bump in the Night
Sorin's Thirst
Memoricide

This thing is going to an auto-include in any staple w/u control deck, and with damn good reason.

Edit:

Just so people know, Curse of Death's Hold shuts this card down. It can't flashback if it can't enter the battlefield, so keep that curse safe and it will keep you safe.
